clauses.text: (5) RMIT commits to a fair, transparent and consistent promotions framework.
(6) The promotions framework is based on:
objective determinations, with decisions based on evidence of achievement and impact at RMIT

equal promotion opportunity for all staff that does not discriminate on the grounds of gender, pregnancy, ethnicity, marital status, disability, sexual preference, transgender status, political or religious beliefs, or age
due recognition of the diversity of academic roles, practice and career trajectories
assessment of Achievement Relative to Opportunity through consideration of fractional appointments and other work circumstances, personal circumstances, or both
alignment with the RMIT strategy.
(7) RMIT will ensure information to support applicants for academic promotion is clear, current and relevant.
(8) Opportunity for academic promotion will be:
available for applicants to level B at any time
run for academic levels C, D and E and structured to enable the announcement of promotions effective as of 1 January of the following year
permitted outside of the scheduled promotion round only in exceptional circumstances.
(9) Unless an exemption has been granted under the relevant procedure, academic staff will not be eligible to apply for promotion in the year immediately following an unsuccessful application.
(10) Promotion determinations are made to the level immediately above the applicant’s substantive classification.

(11) In exceptional circumstances the Vice-Chancellor can approve a request for the relevant Academic Promotion Committee to consider an application for promotion to a level higher than the level immediately above the applicant’s substantive position.
(12) Applicants may lodge an appeal against an application decision or a promotion outcome on the grounds specified in the Academic Promotion Procedure - Appeals.
(13) The Deputy Vice-Chancellor Education is responsible for:
constituting the membership of all Academic Promotion Committees
approving promotion recommendations put forward by the University Academic Promotion Committee.
(14) The Vice President, People and Culture is responsible for:
approving procedures for academic promotion to levels B, C, D and E
the provision of training in equal employment principles for all promotion committee members.
(15) The University Academic Promotion Committee (UAPC) is responsible for:
monitoring the promotion process with a view to ensuring fairness and compliance with the application of the policy and procedures
analysing the promotion process with regard to academic quality standards and equal opportunity, including reviewing diversity of participation and achievement
reviewing the promotion recommendations from the promotion committees and moderators
reviewing this policy and related procedures as required and recommending any necessary changes to Academic Board.

(16) Deputy Vice-Chancellors (or their nominated delegates) are responsible for reviewing and approving/denying requests from academic staff who wish to apply for promotion in the year immediately following an unsuccessful application.
(17) This policy will be reviewed annually on completion of the promotion round in consultation with the Vice President, People and Culture.
(18) This policy includes the following schedule(s):
Schedule 1 – Academic Promotion Committees Schedule
Schedule 2 - University Academic Promotion Committee
Schedule 3 - University Academic Promotion Appeals Committee
(19) Refer to the following documents which are established in accordance with this Policy:
Academic Promotion Procedure - Level B
Academic Promotion Procedure - Levels C, D and E
Academic Promotion Procedure - Appeals
Academic Promotion Procedure - Out of Round
